thread.title: [CES 2017]: ZTE announces Blade V8 Pro and crowdsourced Hawkeye smartphones
thread.title_full: [CES 2017]: ZTE announces Blade V8 Pro and crowdsourced Hawkeye smartphones

title: [CES 2017]: ZTE announces Blade V8 Pro and crowdsourced Hawkeye smartphones
text:
January 5, 2017 “The Hawkeye comes with eye-tracking and self-adhesive properties” 
ZTE has introduced two new Android smartphones – the Hawkeye and Blade V8 Pro – at this year’s CES in Las Vegas. The Blade V8 Pro is the company’s first smartphone to feature dual cameras at the back. The ZTE Hawkeye is a crowdsourced smartphone on Kickstarter, which boasts eye-tracking and self-adhesive properties. 
Talking about the ZTE Hawkeye first, the phone allows you to scroll pages and images in the gallery using eye-tracking. It will come with an optional case with self-adhesive back panel, which allows the device to stick on a flat surface and be used hands-free. As for the other specs, it comes with a 5.5-inch full HD display, a fingerprint sensor, Hi-Fi audio, two SIM slots, expandable storage, Android Nougat, and fast charging capabilities. 
The ZTE Blade V8 Pro features two 13-megapixel cameras at the back with phase detection autofocus and dual-LED flash, along with an 8-megapixel selfie snapper. It features a 5.5-inch full HD IPS LCD display, a 2.0GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 SoC and 3GB of RAM. The phone offers 32GB of expandable storage, Android Marshmallow, 4G LTE, NFC, a USB Type-C port, and a 3,140mAh battery. 
The ZTE Hawkeye is listed on Kickstarter for $199, around Rs 13,500, with an estimated delivery date of September 2017. The Blade V8 Pro has been priced at $229.98, roughly Rs 15,600. It is currently up for pre-order in the US. Facebook Comments
